item.title: Avoid Github Government Block
item.description: I cannot believe this… How in his right mind requires to block github because of terrorism? Open source code is freedom, not terrorism. Anyway, here is how to avoid it.

item.title: Mandelbrot Parallel Computation
item.description: This post explains how to parallelize the computational task of the Mandelbrot set and generate a terminal tool to generate images.

item.description: I’ve attended to a Leadership training by Enric Llad√≥, thanks to ERNI, and this is the summary of it.

item.title: Go CPU profiling
item.description: Let’s take a look to Go CPU profiling tools to optimize the mandelbrot set calculation from previous post.

item.title: Mandelbrot Set Calculation
item.description: The Mandelbrot set is one of the most famous fractals and it is really simple to draw. Personally I enjoy a lot seeing how simple rules lead to complex patterns.

item.title: Create a Blog Like This
item.description: A blog like this can be generated with Hugo.io hosted for free using Github.com.

item.title: Why This Blog
item.description: I’m starting this blog to have feedback of my improvement over time.

item.title: About Me
item.description: About MetalBlueberry I’m a passionate developer moving toward the specialization in IoT technologies. I feel comfortable working with Python and Go as most of my recent development time has been invested with those two languages but I have experience with other popular languages such as C/C++, C# and Java. I’m always looking for new challenges and constantly learning new things. Technical background I’ve experience with several technologies from the IoT world from the sensors to the cloud infrastructure.

item.title: About Me - The long story
item.description: About MetalBlueberry I’m a programmer since I discovered that things could be automated. Attention You are about to read my life since I remember it, focused on how I became a professional developer. The beginning I started with Win-logo in the school by drawing some figures with simple functions. I still remember what could be one of the firsts function I’ve ever wrote. tits(size) The objective is clear, draw two tangent circles of a desired size.
